answers.answer: A little spotting in early pregnancy can be normal.  If the bleeding becomes heavy, is accompanied by clots or pain that would be cause for concern.High blood pressure during pregnancy can be very dangerous for mom and baby - if this happens during the 2nd or 3rd trimester the doctor will monitor you closely and possibly give meds to control BP.Do you have a history of high BP?  Sometimes, BP will rise due to "white coat syndrome" (stress caused from going to the doctor/hospital) so thats a possibility.

I have high blood pressure as well... tho it hasn't been diagnosed because of my age (i'll be 33 at end of Jan). So we'll see how this pregnancy goes. I do know it's going to be high risk because of it. I'm sure as I progress they'll put me on BP meds. I also got gestational diabetes with my last pregnancy.

It's very important to treat your high blood pressure now as it affects both the baby, placenta, and your own body in alot of different ways. If it gets too high, you can suffer a stroke which can be very catastrophic.There are safe drugs you can take while pregnant (I'm on labetalol to control mine). I'm not sure what your age has to do with it not being diagnosed -- how high is it?

question: so im 6w1d today i found out 3days ago i was having another baby.. went in to the emergncy room because i had a little spoting that was a brownish pink is that normal? and nother questions what does high blood pressure cause to a baby? im just worryed about having a miscarriage.. thanks
title: Normal?
